question: If A is an m × n matrix and A has n pivot positions then the columns of A span Rm.
The equation Ax = b has a solution if the vector b is a linear combination of the columns of A.
If an augmented matrix [ A | b ] can be transformed by elementary row operations into [ C | d ], then the equations Ax = b and Cx = d have exactly the same solution sets.
If S = span{0} then S is a set containing a single vector.
If w is a linear combination of u and v in Rn, then u is a linear combination of v and w.
A linear transformation T : Rn → Rm is completely determined by its effect on the columns of the n × n identity matrix.
Not every linear transformation from Rn to Rm is a matrix transformation.
The co-domain of the transformation x → Ax is the set of all linear combinations of the columns of A.
Given a linearly independent set of vectors {v1, v2, v3}, 0 ∈ span{v1, v2, v3}
A mapping T : Rn → Rm is onto Rm if every vector x ∈ Rn maps onto some vector in Rm.
If a set contains fewer vectors than there are entries in the vectors, then the set is linearly independent.
